mechanics.condition: Point on a wooden, plaster, or stone surface within range and sight is chosen
mechanics.outcome: A passage appears with chosen dimensions (up to 5 feet wide, 8 feet tall, 20 feet deep) and lasts for the duration

mechanics.condition: Passwall creates an opening in a structure
mechanics.outcome: No instability is created in the surrounding structure

mechanics.condition: Creatures or objects are still within the passage
mechanics.outcome: Creatures or objects are safely ejected to an unoccupied space nearest to the surface where the spell was cast

description_text: A passage appears at a point of your choice that you can see on a wooden, plaster, or stone surface (such as a wall, a ceiling, or a floor) within range, and lasts for the duration. You choose the opening's dimensions: up to 5 feet wide, 8 feet tall, and 20 feet deep. The passage creates no instability in a structure surrounding it. When the opening disappears, any creatures or objects still in the passage created by the spell are safely ejected to an unoccupied space nearest to the surface on which you cast the spell.
